results.title: Young and Innocent = a Girl Was Young
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Edward Black, Gainsborough Pictures and GFD
results.brief_description: A mysterious man with a twitch in his eye; a young woman’s body washed ashore along with the raincoat belt used to strangle her; the supposedly innocent owner of the raincoat, fleeing from the police and frantically seeking the real murderer - all these elements combine to produce a full-speed, nail-biting mystery melodrama from the master of suspense, Alfred Hitchcock. Based on the novel A shilling for candles by Josephine Tey.

results.title: Drowning by numbers
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Denis Wigman, Kees Kasander and Film Four International
results.brief_description: A tale of three women with the same name, whose solidarity with one another brings about three copy-cat murders. They drown their husbands - one in a tin bath, one in the sea and one in a swimming pool. An ironic, black comedy that celebrates the English obsession with gameplaying, sex and death. Stars Joan Plowright, Juliet Stevenson, Joely Richardson and Bernard Hill.

results.title: Jean de Florette
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Lavish film version of Marcel Pagnol’s tale of a simple man who leaves the city to live on an inherited piece of land but is ruined when he fails to find water to irrigate his property because the location of an underground spring is kept secret from him by two scheming villagers who wish to take over the farm. The conclusion to this story comes in the sequel, “Manon des Sources”. “Jean de Florette” stars Yves Montand and Gerard Depardieu.

results.title: The Thin man
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, Hunt Stromberg, Cosmopolitan and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Dashiell Hammett’s 1932 detective novel, “The thin man”, was a best- seller sought by every major Hollywood studio. MGM won out and the result is a crime thriller combined with high comedy. As Nick and Nora Charles, the wisecracking darlings of society, William Powell and Myrna Loy made history portraying two sophisticates who are not only married but also very much in love, also stars Cesar Romero.

results.title: From here to eternity
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Buddy Adler and Columbia
results.brief_description: A searing indictment of military life, where one walks the line or pays the price. In a peacetime army camp in Hawaii, the commander’s wife, Deborah Kerr, and career soldier, Burt Lancaster, risk everything in a love affair that could destroy them. Persecuted by his peers, hard-headed Prewitt (Montgomery Clift) wants to settle down with prostitute Donna Reed, but she yearns for a better life. Prewitt’s only friend, Frank Sinatra, stands up to sadistic guard, Ernest Borgnine, and pays the ultimate price. The film culminates in an explosive climax on December 7, 1941, with the attack on Pearl Harbour. “From Here to Eternity” is a riveting drama, considered one of Hollywood’s greatest achievements. Based on the novel by James Jones.

results.title: The Mouse that roared
results.creator_credit: Jack Arnold, Carl Foreman and Columbia
results.brief_description: The near-bankrupt Duchy of Grand Fenwick plans to declare war on the USA, be defeated and thus be eligible for Marshall Aid to rebuild its economy. One of those films in which Peter Sellers engagingly plays three parts, effectively carrying the entire film. Based on the novel by Leonard Wibberley.

results.title: Salvador
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Gerald Green and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Seduced by the lure of cheap drink, drugs and sex, an experienced photo- journalist goes with his friend to El Salvador in the early 1980s. Once there they see the turmoil and brutality of the country as it is being destroyed by the conflict, and learn of American involvement. Largely based on the experiences of Richard Boyle, a photo-journalist there in the 1980s. Stars James Woods, James Belushi and Michael Murphy.

results.title: Strangers on a train
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Patricia Highsmith’s chilling thriller, “Strangers on a train”, this is one of Alfred Hitchcock’s most suspenseful and exciting films. Two passengers accidentally meet on a train. Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker) offers to kill the wife of Guy Haines (Farley Granger), if Guy in return murders Bruno’s father. The excellent script was co-written by Raymond Chandler and the film features a climax in a fairground which is among Hitchcock’s finest directing moments.

results.title: Klute
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Her name is Bree Daniels. She’s a tough, high-priced call girl picking her way through the tangled lives that touch hers in the dark maze of New York. Bree once crossed paths with a vicious psychotic killer, who is now stalking her. The only person that can save her is Detective John Klute. Stars Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland. Excellent adult thriller with attention to detail and emphasis on character.
